lines.text:
[Speaking to Marica]
When a man is a killer, arsonist, a cheat and a coward, it's hardly surprising if he turns out to be a liar as well.
What the hell are they shooting?
When you tell an Indian things will be a certain way and then they're not, he's inclined to think maybe you crossed him.
There's more ways to pacify Indians than shootin' holes in them!
I reckon we come down to it, Deakin.
You have a choice. You could throw that gun down.
I don't think I can do that.
Thank God we didn't lose those medical supplies.
Not much good without a doctor.

[to Deakin]
You're a doctor, or so you said.
Simple charity to your fellow man.

[pointing at Pearce]
My 'fellow man' is about to hang me!

Dr. Molineaux is dead, two of the Major's best officers are missing, and we can't get through to Myrtle... Nobody heard anything, nobody saw anything, and nobody knows anything. It can only get better.
Well, maybe they were accidents after all. And we just might have seen the end of it.
